Bubbles.title: Take Your Time
Bubbles.text: While visiting an artist's work in a museum or art gallery, take your time to look at the artwork carefully. Consider how the elements of art work together in harmony to create the principle of design known as unity.

Bubbles.title: Ask Questions
Bubbles.text: Asking questions about an artwork shows that you're interested and thinking about the artwork in a critical way.

Bubbles.title: Look, Don't Touch
Bubbles.text: Sometimes, artists spend months and even years creating their artworks. If you reach out and touch an artwork, the oil from your hands can damage or ruin an artwork. If you're unsure whether or not you can touch an artwork, always ask an adult first.

Bubbles.title: Ask Before Taking Photos
Bubbles.text: Not all artists want their artworks to be photographed and shared. Before taking your camera out and snapping a picture, be sure to look for signs or ask an adult for permission.

Bubbles.title: Brainstorm Constructive Criticism
Bubbles.text: While looking at an artwork, begin to think of some constructive criticism you'd like to give back to the artist. Receiving constructive criticism is how artists continue to grow and master their skills.

TextVersion:
Respecting Artwork

Take Your Time: While visiting an artist's work in a museum or art gallery, take your time to look at the artwork carefully. Consider how the elements of art work together in harmony to create the principle of design known as unity.

Ask Questions: Asking questions about an artwork shows that you're interested and thinking about the artwork in a critical way.

Look, Don't Touch: Sometimes, artists spend months and even years creating their artworks. If you reach out and touch an artwork, the oil from your hands can damage or ruin an artwork. If you're unsure whether or not you can touch an artwork, always ask an adult first.

Ask Before Taking Photos: Not all artists want their artworks to be photographed and shared. Before taking your camera out and snapping a picture, be sure to look for signs or ask an adult for permission.

Brainstorm Constructive Criticism: While looking at an artwork, begin to think of some constructive criticism you'd like to give back to the artist. Receiving constructive criticism is how artists continue to grow and master their skills.
